NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist.synopsis: Paired sequential AD for the Nymph and the Flaming Fist lovers in the Nymph's Grotoo room of Sharess Caress. It is played before the fist transformation into a Mind Flayer later on.
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess Caress, Nymph's Grotto room upstairs.

Cat.synopsis: Dialog for the Mamzell Amira's cat. "The mascot of Sharess' Caress, a longhair ragdoll, She gazes at you with half-lidded eyes but keeps her opinion to herself. "
Cat.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess' Caress, 21; 44; 79Talk to the cat.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway.synopsis: Boasting crooks threeway dialog. Earspoon, a Rivington Rat, and Borgus, a Zhentarim smuggler, are chatting over dice.

AD_Mamzell_Welcome.synopsis: One-shot AD for Mamzell Amira that she plays welcoming the players when they enter Sharess Caress'.

BoastingCrooks_Rat.synopsis: Small dialog for the Rivington Rat in Sharess Caress.
BoastingCrooks_Rat.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess Caress, 31; 44; 85Talk to any of the two Boasting Crooks in Sharess Caress to trigger their 3-way dialog, then talk to Earspoon again.

Taproom_Bartender.synopsis: Bartender in Sharess' caress, vendor for drinks and such.
Taproom_Bartender.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess' CaressClick on bartender at 22; 87

BoastingCrooks_Zhent.synopsis: Boasting crooks - Zhent standalone dialog. One liner.
BoastingCrooks_Zhent.how_to_trigger: 30; 88Experience threeway dialogue, then click on Borgus.

AD_Chef.synopsis: Repeated sequential AD for the Sharess Caress' chef in the kitchen.

Musician_01.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for a halfling musician who plays violin for a dancing show in Sharess Caress'.
Musician_01.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess Caress', taproom, stage room

Taproom_DrunkFist.synopsis: Flaming Fist in Sharess' Caress. One -liner. He's drunk off his gourd.
Taproom_DrunkFist.how_to_trigger: Approach 21; 85 and click on Flaming Fist or nymph. Let the nymph choose her own decision, finish scene, and click on Fist after.

Taproom_NymphWaitress.synopsis: Default dialogue for Irenya - a nymph standing next to a bar in a taproom accompanied by a flaming fist.
Taproom_NymphWaitress.how_to_trigger: Approach 21; 85 and click on Flaming Fist or nymph. Go through scene, and talk to her again.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphPostCombat.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD for the Nymph in Sharess Caress' Nymph's Grotto room, after the combat with her client who transformed into a Mind Flayer.
NymphRoom_AD_NymphPostCombat.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, 27; 52; 83Proceed through scene, make sure the Nymph survives the combat.

BasementRat.synopsis: A small SwA dialog with a rat inside food storage basement of Sharess Caress.

HollyphantDetective.synopsis: Dialog with Valeria in Sharess Caress.She is very dismissive no matter what you found in Open Hand temple.
HollyphantDetective.how_to_trigger: goto > Act3 > WYR > Start goto -44; 46; -4talk to Valeriagoto 23; 47; 91talk to Valeria again

AD_WarlockBartender.synopsis: Sequential repeated AD between Korrilla and bartender Hoots, while both of them in Sharess Caress taproom. Korrilla is drinking at the bar, standing, while Hoots serves the drinks.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist.synopsis: You encounter a nymph getting down with a flaming fist, when suddenly there is a mind meld and the fist turns into a mind flayer right then and there!
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess Caress' upper floor, Nymph's Grotto room.Approach the nymph and her patron at 24, 51, 93 and click on one of them to initiate.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist.synopsis: Player approaches a nymph courtesan and customer. The customer is flirting with her, and she is using it to her advantage. The player can ask if everything is all right. They can also interfere and get the drunk to leave, possibly thinking they're helping, but they're not. Both are standing.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist.how_to_trigger: Approach 21; 85 and click on Flaming Fist or nymph.

AD_NymphDrunkFist.synopsis: Sequential repeated AD between the drunk flaming fist and the nymph who's working there in Sharess Caress. They sit at the bar in the taproom.

Chef.synopsis: A small dialog for the chef in Sharess Caress, from whom you can buy some supplies.
Chef.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess' Caress, 29; 43; 97Talk to the man in the kitchen.

Taproom_Mamzell.synopsis: Mamzell Amira is worried about her missing escort. You get a chance to take the quest or deny it here. If you take it, she gives you a free session with the dapper drow.
Taproom_Mamzell.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A,Go to 19; 80 and click on Mamzell Amira.

NymphRoom_Nymph.synopsis: The nymph reacts to having witnessed her lover/client turn to a mind flayer. She can then offer to treat you to an emotional pick-me-upas a reward for saving her.
NymphRoom_Nymph.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess' Caress upper floor.Approach 24, 51, 93 and witness the scene in which the flaming fist turns to a mind flayer. Defeat the mind flayer and speak to the nymph.

BoastingCrooks_AD.synopsis: These two boastful crooks are slightly drunk and speaking louder than they should be about confidential matters. This is just an AD to get players' attention. It's repeated on occasion until the interactive threeway dialog is done. It should only be partially heard and spoken.

Dancer_01.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for a female human dancer performing on the stage in Sharess Caress'.
Dancer_01.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess Caress', taproom, stage room

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_0.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_0.text: Forget your work, these four walls are our world.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_2.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_2.text: Sorry, I've just felt so distracted recently. Such fog coursing through my brain.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_1.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_1.text: Look at me. You need only think of me.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_6.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_6.text: Don't fret, you don't have to think about a thing.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_5.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_5.text: I want to, but I just have such a headache.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_3.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_3.text: I wish I could kiss you better, I mean to try.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_7.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_AD_NymphFlamingFist_7.text: ...Lovely. And nice... Ah, I'm not sure I'm up to much.

Cat_17.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_17.text: Come to pay your respects to the real lady of the house, I see. What a clever creature you are!
Cat_17.context: NodeContext: Regal; like royalty greeting a subject

Cat_24.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_24.text: It's your lucky day. I am receiving compliments at this time, and you are most welcome to make an offering.
Cat_24.context: NodeContext: As if this is a great privilege

Cat_1.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_1.text: Good things come to those who are forthcoming - but only if they make it count.
Cat_1.context: NodeContext: Gracious explanation; pointed after the -

Cat_34.speaker: Player
Cat_34.text: Your eyes are two baleful jewels that strike fear into the most complacent of rats.

Cat_15.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_15.text: Ah, you are quite correct - I consider them one of my finest features.

Cat_31.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_31.text: The unwashed rabble who frequent this establishment have much to learn from your deference. And I must suffer their foibles alone.

Cat_7.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_7.text: But they do say a burden shared is a burden halved...
Cat_7.context: NodeContext: Meaningfully - she wants to gossip with the player

Cat_20.speaker: Player
Cat_20.text: What's that shady pair over there whispering about?

Cat_19.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_19.text: Can't you hear from here? They're talking about the new top cat in the criminal underbelly - go and listen for yourself.
Cat_19.context: NodeContext: Seemingly disappointed the player doesn't have cat hearing

Cat_21.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_21.text: As for them personally: one never washes and instead douses himself with rose oil, while the other can't hold his drink.

Cat_5.speaker: Player
Cat_5.text: Do I want to know about who's through those fancy curtains?

Cat_28.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_28.text: The drow - two of our most popular courtesans. A night with them seems to be rather life changing - if you can afford it.

Cat_13.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_13.text: Of course, they are siblings - but judging from the throngs of clients they draw, most of the city is as disgusting as they are.

Cat_35.speaker: Player
Cat_35.text: What are your thoughts on the clientele as a whole?

Cat_12.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_12.text: That's rather a broad topic - we get all sorts here. But there is one frequent visitor whose very presence offends me.

Cat_2.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_2.text: He dresses fabulously but stinks of the Hells - something infernal, to be sure. Abhorrent.
Cat_2.context: NodeContext: Clear she does NOT like this person

Cat_6.speaker: Player
Cat_6.text: Your paws are fit to overturn only the daintiest crystalware.

Cat_16.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_16.text: Sometimes a lady has to make her presence known - delicately, of course.

Cat_32.speaker: Player
Cat_32.text: Your glorious tail can trip an unsuspecting servant with the grace of an empress.

Cat_29.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_29.text: Oh, you flatterer! But you are of course correct. My tail is quite the marvel.

Cat_30.speaker: Player
Cat_30.text: I've got better things to do than compliment a cat.

Cat_14.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_14.text: Then perhaps you would like to go and do them. Get thee hence.

Cat_25.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_25.text: Unhand me, you ham-fisted oaf! You should know better than to touch unasked. Begone!

Cat_26.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_26.text: Ugh - no, thank you. So uncouth.
Cat_26.context: NodeContext: Disgusted disapproval of the player

Cat_27.speaker: Kira the Cat
Cat_27.context: NodeContext: Regally welcoming back the player

Cat_4.speaker: Player
Cat_4.text: You're a pretty kitty, aren't you?

Cat_10.speaker: Player
Cat_10.text: Reach out to pet the cat.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_2.speaker: Narrator
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_2.text: *The two men bark softly to each other. A single name reaches your ears: 'Nine-Fingers'.*

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_55.speaker: Narrator
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_55.text: *It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_6.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_6.text: Talking about Nine-Fingers? I've got business with her.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_27.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_27.text: Oh yeah? Seems everyone's got business with her. Heard the gal met her match.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_35.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_35.text: Hey, you still lurking about? I don't remember inviting you to the party.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_75.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_75.text: Don't know who you're talking about. So clear out, hm?

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_64.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_64.text: You Rats with the Guild now? Heard Nine-Fingers met her match.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_5.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_5.text: The new kingpin? All meat and muscle, that one. And wild as a werebear. If he's looking to oust Nine-Fingers, my blade's got his back.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_29.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_29.text: Sounds messy as the ninth hell. Must be why she called us to help.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_48.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_48.text: Is that right? The way I heard it, you Zhent cut a deal with the new... hold on.
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Borgus, but then noticing player is listening in

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_73.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_73.text: You there - getting up in our affairs?
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player, who is caught eavedropping

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_30.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_30.text: I need to talk to Nine-Fingers about Zenovia.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_3.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_3.text: Hmm. Better you than me. Now listen - I'll only say this once:

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_62.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_62.text: Come on, level with me. I'm not about to sell out another dwarf.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_26.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_26.text: All the dwarf sellouts I know would disagree.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_12.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_12.text: Now cut out. This here's a private function.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_1.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_1.text: I bet a few coins would loosen your tongue. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_14.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_14.text: Nice - I promise I'll put it to good use.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_54.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_54.text: Now, this subject's not safe, so listen close - I'm only saying it once:

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_40.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_40.text: I'm short on gold, I'm afraid.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_36.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_36.text: My tongue's not for sale. Now scram - this conversation's done, over, finished.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_59.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_59.text: I'm looking to join the Guild. How about you point me the way?

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_37.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_37.text: And risk my neck? I don't think so.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_77.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_77.text: Sounds like an interesting business. I'd like to take part.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_58.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_58.text: Look - this subject's not safe. You selling your services, beat feet to the Guild hall.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_51.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_51.text: Lower City. Basilisk Gate. Guildhall. And that's all you're getting from me.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_15.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_15.text: Now scram. The chat's officially closed.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_17.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_17.text: Good luck with that, chum. My mouth's buttoned.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_19.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_19.text: Nine-Fingers won't be happy about Zenovia. And I'm not about to tell her.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_68.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_68.text: Hey Borgus - this snooper's up in my brain. Time they learn a thing or two!

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_7.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_7.text: I need work, and it sounds like Nine-Fingers needs steel.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_20.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_20.text: And? You're airing private matters in a brothel.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_4.speaker: Borgus Elamin
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_4.text: Heh - they've got you there, Spoon.

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_49.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_49.text: Don't matter - this discussion doesn't concern you. So why don't you make tracks?

BoastingCrooks_Threeway_57.speaker: Narrator
BoastingCrooks_Threeway_57.text: *No matter how hard you concentrate, you can make no sense of their conversation.*

BoastingCrooks_Rat_4.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_4.text: Step off, chum. I can hear you breathing.

BoastingCrooks_Rat_12.speaker: Player
BoastingCrooks_Rat_12.text: Here's your gold. Now tell me about Nine-Fingers. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

BoastingCrooks_Rat_11.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_11.text: Nice - I promise I'll put it to good use.

BoastingCrooks_Rat_9.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_9.text: Now, this subject's not safe, so listen close - I'm only saying it once:

BoastingCrooks_Rat_7.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_7.text: Lower City. Basilisk Gate. Guildhall. And that's all you're getting from me.

BoastingCrooks_Rat_2.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_2.text: Now scram. The chat's officially closed.

BoastingCrooks_Rat_0.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_0.text: I want to be sandwiched between a pair of nymphs.

BoastingCrooks_Rat_3.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_3.text: If you can spare the coin to get me what I want, I can give you what you want.

BoastingCrooks_Rat_6.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_Rat_6.text: You want entertainment? Try the circus.

Taproom_Bartender_6.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_6.text: Rustled Irenya's feathers, eh? Well, no harm done. Her moneymaker catches more Fist than a frog catches flies.
Taproom_Bartender_6.context: NodeContext: Loud and boisterous but never obnoxious.

Taproom_Bartender_19.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_19.text: Now, that there's a face I'd remember if I'd seen it. Welcome to Sharess' Caress!
Taproom_Bartender_19.context: NodeContext: Loud and boisterous but never obnoxious.

Taproom_Bartender_33.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_33.text: What can Hoots do you for, stranger? You got a taste for ale, I reckon. Or maybe -
Taproom_Bartender_33.context: NodeContext: Starts to recommend her newest brew...

Taproom_Bartender_52.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_52.text: Ah, forget it. My new brew could drop you in the wink of a spectator's eye.
Taproom_Bartender_52.context: NodeContext: ...and then changes her mind. But cheeky about it.

Taproom_Bartender_3.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_3.text: I need something potent. What do you have?

Taproom_Bartender_57.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_57.text: Try Hoots' Hooch. Cuts real deep.

Taproom_Bartender_9.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_9.text: You got it - but the new hooch is off-limits. Can't have the Mamzell leaping down my throat if I go burning yours.

Taproom_Bartender_47.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_47.text: Your new brew sounds potent. I'll give that a try.

Taproom_Bartender_29.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_29.text: I don't know about that, chum. Hoots' Hooch packs a stronger wallop than all ten of my knuckles.

Taproom_Bartender_31.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_31.text: Could beef you up, sharpen your tongue - or knock you out cold. No telling 'til the first drop hits your gullet.

Taproom_Bartender_10.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_10.text: I'll take my chances on the hooch.

Taproom_Bartender_24.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_24.text: Damn - this one knows what they want!

Taproom_Bartender_50.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_50.text: First one's on the house. So don't come bawling to me if your big toes fall off or your tongue coils in a knot!
Taproom_Bartender_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leans forward, gives you the drink just below camera, and it goes into player inventory.

Taproom_Bartender_18.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_18.text: I'd like to see what else you have.

Taproom_Bartender_5.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_5.text: Cold feet, eh? Don't blame you. Left my first wife at the altar. Some flavours just aren't worth tasting.

Taproom_Bartender_36.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_36.text: What's the story of this place?

Taproom_Bartender_35.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_35.text: Sharess' Caress? The Mamzell's brainchild. 'Wet your tongue, soak your skin, scratch your itch.'

Taproom_Bartender_53.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_53.text: Get the attention you want - and avoid the attention you don't.

Taproom_Bartender_26.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_26.text: I bet a barkeep in this place hears all sorts of stories.

Taproom_Bartender_4.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_4.text: My business is slinging tankards, not hoarding secrets. I'd like to keep it that way.

Taproom_Bartender_28.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_28.text: But you poke some folk hard enough, they're bound to squeal. And Mamzell Amira there looks about ready to burst.

Taproom_Bartender_51.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_51.text: Look, we both know how this works - rumours, jobs, anything - I want the details.

Taproom_Bartender_1.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_1.text: Oh, you're one of those types. Rude as you are sneaky.

Taproom_Bartender_39.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_39.text: Press your belly to the bar, chum.

Taproom_Bartender_45.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_45.text: Looking for flavour to savour? Perhaps -

Taproom_Bartender_48.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_48.text: Well? Whaddya think, now you had a swig of the hooch?

Taproom_Bartender_54.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_54.text: It's godsdamned good, is what I think.

Taproom_Bartender_46.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_46.text: Hells yeah, and blessings to the drunken god!

Taproom_Bartender_30.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_30.text: You fancy another? Or just hankerin' for chat?

Taproom_Bartender_25.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_25.text: Never again. What in the Hells did you put in there?

Taproom_Bartender_27.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_27.text: Pinch of this, smidgen of that. Least you still got your tongue. Last customer wasn't so lucky.

Taproom_Bartender_34.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_34.text: The Flaming Fist should lock you up for selling the stuff.

Taproom_Bartender_56.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_56.text: A manip's the one who brought me the fixings! A Fist's stomach's stronger than a mountain troll on a bender.

Taproom_Bartender_55.speaker: Player
Taproom_Bartender_55.text: I'd rather not talk about it.

Taproom_Bartender_23.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_23.text: That rough, eh? Well you can't say I didn't warn you. Buyer beware, and all that junk.

Taproom_Bartender_44.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
Taproom_Bartender_44.text: Try something else? Or just feeling things out?

AD_Chef_0.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
AD_Chef_0.text: Will you tell Sorn that snails are not an aphrodisiac? They're just salty. There's a difference.

AD_Chef_1.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
AD_Chef_1.text: That was the finest strudel I've made, and they just ate it off of each other's arses!

AD_Chef_2.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
AD_Chef_2.text: Gods above, the cucumbers have been taken from the pantry. Again.

Musician_01_0.speaker: Monsieur Chapeau
Musician_01_0.text: I know my fingering is immaculate, but you can compliment me afterwards.

Musician_01_1.speaker: Monsieur Chapeau
Musician_01_1.text: Enjoy the fiddling? Throw a few coins our way, and let us play on into the night!

Taproom_DrunkFist_0.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_DrunkFist_0.text: The nymph's got a sweet tongue and a figure to match, eh?
Taproom_DrunkFist_0.context: NodeContext: Drunk off his gourd. Final 'eh' is seeking agreement from the person he's talking to

Taproom_DrunkFist_1.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_DrunkFist_1.text: Hells. That ale packs a punch.

Taproom_NymphWaitress_0.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_NymphWaitress_0.text: Sorry, sweetheart. I've got someone to take care of.

Taproom_NymphWaitress_2.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_NymphWaitress_2.text: You want a drink? Hoots is your woman. You want pleasure? See Mamzell Amira.

Taproom_NymphWaitress_4.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_NymphWaitress_4.text: Listen, sweetheart - I'm sure you meant well. You want to help? Open your coinpurse.

Taproom_NymphWaitress_1.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_NymphWaitress_1.text: Start with Hoots, if your whistle needs wetting. You want extra attention? Try Mamzell Amira.

NymphRoom_AD_NymphPostCombat_2.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_AD_NymphPostCombat_2.text: I - I'll never find another as beautiful.

BasementRat_2.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_2.text: There's no time to waste - seize what you can carry!
BasementRat_2.context: NodeContext: Pretty excited by the food revolution

BasementRat_11.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_11.text: Halt, oppressor! I am reclaiming the victuals in this basement for the good of ratkind!
BasementRat_11.context: NodeContext: Combative - believes they're standing up for what's right

BasementRat_13.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_13.text: Are you not? Well, you aren't one of us.

BasementRat_10.speaker: Player
BasementRat_10.text: How is any of this yours?

BasementRat_0.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_0.text: Just like the rest of your kind, aren't you?

BasementRat_19.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_19.text: You lot hoard your delectable riches while my brothers and sisters starve!

BasementRat_9.speaker: Player
BasementRat_9.text: I don't want you and your family to starve - take what you need.

BasementRat_14.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_14.text: We will! And we don't need your permission!

BasementRat_4.speaker: Player
BasementRat_4.text: I'm with you - food should be shared and enjoyed, not hidden away.

BasementRat_21.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_21.text: Exactly! And what good is displaying such morsels and not eating them? Food is for eating, friend!
BasementRat_21.context: NodeContext: Passionately (and pleased the player is on their side)

BasementRat_6.speaker: Player
BasementRat_6.text: I'll stay out of your way.

BasementRat_3.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_3.text: Good - your traitorous clodhoppers stand in the way of justice!

BasementRat_1.speaker: Player
BasementRat_1.text: You shouldn't be stealing, you filthy little vermin.

BasementRat_27.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_27.text: Very well - discretion is the better part of valour.
BasementRat_27.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but trying to leave with dignity

BasementRat_7.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_7.text: But in the dead of night, when sleep overcomes your stinking flesh pile, our bellies will be filled!
BasementRat_7.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but trying to leave with dignity; a rodent threat

BasementRat_24.speaker: Player
BasementRat_24.text: I'm also here to do that, actually.

BasementRat_12.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_12.text: Then... you're one of us? You believe in the equal distribution of food regardless of species?
BasementRat_12.context: NodeContext: Tentatively; believes the player might on their side

BasementRat_25.speaker: Player
BasementRat_25.text: Sure. Now let's grab what we can and get out of here.

BasementRat_23.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_23.text: Yes! Victuals for all! May you brux until your eyes boggle!
BasementRat_23.context: NodeContext: Happy that the player is on their side; zealous celebration

BasementRat_8.speaker: Player
BasementRat_8.text: Oh yes. And you should definitely rise and overthrow those oppressors while you're at it.

BasementRat_22.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_22.text: We shall! We will fly in the face of the oppressors and their foolish laws! Leave no crust unnibbled!

BasementRat_5.speaker: Player
BasementRat_5.text: Do what you want - I don't care.

BasementRat_17.speaker: Rat
BasementRat_17.text: Leave me be - I have siblings to forage for.

HollyphantDetective_73.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_73.text: I presume you've found something interesting to discuss, if you're interrupting me again?

HollyphantDetective_98.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_98.text: One more for the road and I'll get to it. Wyrm's Crossing... Blasted place...

HollyphantDetective_99.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_99.text: Another case closed, another bottle open! Huzzah to Valeri-AH!
HollyphantDetective_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gives a hearty laugh and then drinksNodeContext: They are emphasizing the "ah" of "valeria" to make it rhyme with huzzah - very very drunk

HollyphantDetective_17.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_17.text: Hang on a tick, I recognise that face. You were talking to Yannis after I left the temple, I'll bet she's put you up to something.

HollyphantDetective_6.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_6.text: Well, you won't get a sip for free, I insist you work for it.

HollyphantDetective_66.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_66.text: Propose a toast, and if it's worth drinking to, that is what we shall do.

HollyphantDetective_100.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_100.text: I'll toast you when we actually solve Father Lorgan's murder. Together.

HollyphantDetective_3.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_3.text: Why must you busybodies insist on interrupting a perfectly good night of...
HollyphantDetective_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

HollyphantDetective_78.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_78.text: You remind me of Devella. Fine - if you doubt my conclusions, out with it. What have you found?

HollyphantDetective_12.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_12.text: My assistant. She's posted in the Lower City investigating Duke Stelmane's murder. Now, back to it - what have you found?

HollyphantDetective_104.speaker: Wyll
HollyphantDetective_104.text: Gods. Stelmane is really gone, then.

HollyphantDetective_27.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_27.text: Father Lorgan's murder is just one part of a bigger plot, a Bhaal plot.

HollyphantDetective_79.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_79.text: A Bhaal plot? You as well?

HollyphantDetective_93.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_93.text: I found the murder weapon you missed in a tunnel under the temple.

HollyphantDetective_10.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_10.text: That's quite the discovery. Doesn't tell me everything, though. Why was Lorgan killed?

HollyphantDetective_56.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_56.text: I assume for the same reason as all the other people on the target list - to gain Bhaal's favour.

HollyphantDetective_5.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_5.text: Maybe he gave really boring sermons.

HollyphantDetective_22.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_22.text: 'Maybe' doesn't quite cut it here, I'm afraid. I need a solid, provable motive.

HollyphantDetective_18.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_18.text: Come back when you've got some real evidence.

HollyphantDetective_26.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_26.text: You want to know why he was murdered? Bhaal.

HollyphantDetective_63.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_63.text: Devella's been harping on about Bhaal for months. Fancies herself something of an expert.

HollyphantDetective_81.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_81.text: I assumed it was just a bunch of conspiracy codswallop and fearmongering, but she's been unusually insistent about this one, even for her.

HollyphantDetective_43.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_43.text: Ugh, fine. I'll bite. What's your theory?

HollyphantDetective_62.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_62.text: It's not a theory - I have proof. This document contains information connecting the murders to the Bhaalist resurgence.

HollyphantDetective_2.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_2.text: No need to wave documents at me. I'm already drowning in paperwork as it is.

HollyphantDetective_13.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_13.text: Constable Devella is going to be a real pain in the trunk about this.

HollyphantDetective_55.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_55.text: Since you seem to be on an obnoxiously similar wavelength, why don't you seek her out. She'll be at the Elfsong Tavern. Show her the list, and I'll stay and inform the Fist here.

HollyphantDetective_1.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_1.text: Oh and you'll need this pass - it'll give you access to the Lower City.
HollyphantDetective_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gestures implying giving something to player off-screen

HollyphantDetective_94.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_94.text: Well? What are you waiting for? You've a bloody conspiracy to solve - move!
HollyphantDetective_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria drinks again, then speaks.

HollyphantDetective_33.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_33.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

HollyphantDetective_29.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_29.text: Father Bhaal is letting his children out to play. His acolytes are out running red and rampant.

HollyphantDetective_24.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_24.text: Well if that's true, that sounds dreadful. And complicated.

HollyphantDetective_54.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_54.text: As if this cult of the Absolute wasn't enough to worry about...

HollyphantDetective_42.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_42.text: Bhaal's recruiting initiates to his cult. Committing murder is how they receive an invite.

HollyphantDetective_25.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_25.text: I reserve judgement until I undertake further investigation.

HollyphantDetective_71.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_71.text: What is it with you young people and this need to investigate everything.

HollyphantDetective_23.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_23.text: Why should I tell you? Doesn't sound like you even care.

HollyphantDetective_36.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_36.text: Well that's just insulting. I am an Investigator, you know. But I'm off the clock... and this is Devella's pet project...
HollyphantDetective_36.context: NodeContext: 'But I'm off the clock...' pondering an opportunity to make the player do the work leaving her to get back to her drinking

HollyphantDetective_91.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_91.text: Isn't it your job to come up with the theories?

HollyphantDetective_14.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_14.text: I'm off the clock. But this is Devella's pet project...

HollyphantDetective_86.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_86.text: If you want motive, perhaps you should look for it. Preferably not at the bottom of a bottle.

HollyphantDetective_19.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_19.text: And if you want to offload your judgement, I suggest you find someone else to bother.

HollyphantDetective_101.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_101.text: Until you have something useful to say, leave me to my bottle. It's better company than you are, that's for sure.

HollyphantDetective_46.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_46.text: I don't have anything for you.

HollyphantDetective_69.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_69.text: Look, if you find something definitive, come back. Until then, leave me to my drink.

HollyphantDetective_97.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_97.text: Could be to do with how he was helping the refugees.

HollyphantDetective_49.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_49.text: 'Could' doesn't quite cut it here, I'm afraid. I need a solid, provable motive.

HollyphantDetective_103.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_103.text: How about the shapeshifting assassins under the temple? That good enough?

HollyphantDetective_84.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_84.text: No. I want proof. If someone else killed Lorgan, I want you to tell me why they did it.

HollyphantDetective_51.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_51.text: I spoke to both corpses. They were killed by a dwarf dressed in red.

HollyphantDetective_58.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_58.text: I spoke with Father Lorgan's corpse. He was killed by a dwarf dressed in red, not Brilgor.

HollyphantDetective_41.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_41.text: I spoke to Brilgor's spirit. A red-clad dwarf killed them both.

HollyphantDetective_68.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_68.text: That doesn't make sense. Why would this dwarf kill Father Lorgan? I need something more than vague allegations.

HollyphantDetective_16.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_16.text: Look, I appreciate the 'amateur investigator' act. It's oddly flattering, with emphasis on the 'odd'. But without hard evidence and an alternate motive, I consider this case closed.

HollyphantDetective_64.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_64.text: I want something compelling. Hard, tangible evidence, and nothing less.

HollyphantDetective_34.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_34.text: I found another body in the Flophouse nearby. I think it's related.

HollyphantDetective_39.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_39.text: You're telling me more than one person has been killed? In Baldur's Gate? You must have something better than that.

HollyphantDetective_74.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_74.text: I need proof. Hard proof. A motive too - otherwise I'm afraid the case remains closed.

HollyphantDetective_87.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_87.text: I need hard evidence and a motive. Why would someone else kill Lorgan? How can we be sure it wasn't Brilgor?

HollyphantDetective_80.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_80.text: A group of shapeshifting assassins were under the temple. Along with more murder victims.

HollyphantDetective_52.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_52.text: While that is startling, it still doesn't disprove my theory that Brilgor killed Father Lorgan, does it?

HollyphantDetective_35.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_35.text: That's what you need if you want to change my mind. Hard evidence. A reason, too, if you're at it. Why was Lorgan killed?

HollyphantDetective_48.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_48.text: I haven't found anything of note.

HollyphantDetective_95.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_95.text: It was the height of arrogance, then, to disturb me. Don't come back unless you've got something worth saying.

HollyphantDetective_102.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_102.text: To lazy conclusions, and even lazier detectives!

HollyphantDetective_53.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_53.text: A tad cliché, but I've drunk to worse. To adventure, and all the dull investigation work it leaves in its wake.

HollyphantDetective_47.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_47.text: Now scram - I'm about to become terrible company.
HollyphantDetective_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

HollyphantDetective_40.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_40.text: That's the worst thing I've seen all month, and I poke around corpses for a living.

HollyphantDetective_7.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_7.text: Now get out of here before you embarrass yourself further.

HollyphantDetective_92.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_92.text: I've changed my mind, keep your booze.

HollyphantDetective_96.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_96.text: I will. And you can keep that snooty attitude, I want none of it.

HollyphantDetective_59.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_59.text: Afraid so - I've found new evidence, Investigator.

HollyphantDetective_37.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_37.text: She asked me to find Lorgan's real killer, seeing as you can't be bothered.

AD_WarlockBartender_0.speaker: Korrilla
AD_WarlockBartender_0.text: PHEW! A blast straight to the heart, was that one.
AD_WarlockBartender_0.context: NodeContext: just drank a particularly strong alcoholic beverage

AD_WarlockBartender_2.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
AD_WarlockBartender_2.text: You know, I was an artificer in another life.

AD_WarlockBartender_1.speaker: Korrilla
AD_WarlockBartender_1.text: Much better to make drinks - you're a true talent.

AD_WarlockBartender_6.speaker: Korrilla
AD_WarlockBartender_6.text: Hoots, please, just make the drinks. I'm not telling you about Raphael's sex life.
AD_WarlockBartender_6.context: NodeContext: 'Hoots' is the barman's name that you're talking to. Indignant, but amused

AD_WarlockBartender_5.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
AD_WarlockBartender_5.text: Someone with all the power of the Nine Hells... He must have brought so many to their knees...
AD_WarlockBartender_5.context: NodeContext: speculating about a devil, fully intending the sexual connotation

AD_WarlockBartender_3.speaker: Korrilla
AD_WarlockBartender_3.text: I promise, you do not want to know.
AD_WarlockBartender_3.context: NodeContext: amused, but firmly shutting down this lnie of conversation

AD_WarlockBartender_8.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
AD_WarlockBartender_8.text: Is your boss here to enjoy himself?

AD_WarlockBartender_4.speaker: Korrilla
AD_WarlockBartender_4.text: Oh, I don't think this kind of establishment is quite to his taste.
AD_WarlockBartender_4.context: NodeContext: the establishment is a brothel - she's being polite, but mischievous

AD_WarlockBartender_7.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
AD_WarlockBartender_7.text: Our Nym is rather refined, but I suppose not nearly enough for him.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_23.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_23.context: NodeContext: Jara is urging her companion to say she is beautiful. They aregazing into each others' eyes. Jara is a flaming fist soldier; Naoise is a nymph courtesan.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_33.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_33.text: More than beautiful. You are the aurora stretched across the north skies. You are the golden dunes swept across the Calim.
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_33.context: NodeContext: Pronounced 'CAL-im', meaning the Calim Desert.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_19.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_19.text: You are the fruit of the forbidden palm. Soft on my skin, sweet on my tongue. You are my sin... and salvation.
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_19.context: NodeContext: Naoise moves  her head closer to Jara's. She is enticing, sexual. She knows how to stir Jara.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_24.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_24.text: *The Flaming Fist's hungry eyes lock with yours. They burn with delirious heat.*
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Flaming Fist's eyes lock with player's, there is no mind meld.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_6.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_6.context: NodeContext: Naoise looks at the Flaming Fist gripping her head and begins to worry.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_28.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_28.text: What are you... wait. I know you.
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flaming FIst Jara turns to player and frowns. She recognises you as a traitor to her cult.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_17.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_17.text: You aren't safe. Get out of here. Now!

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_15.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_15.text: Looks fun. Mind if I join?

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_36.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_36.text: I most certainly do! Jara is a most valued...

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_9.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_9.text: Whoever you think I am, you're mistaken.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_3.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_3.text: Your face. The Absolute has shown me.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_18.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_18.text: Jara, what's going on? Who's this person?

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jara speaks with the voice of the brain. (+ we need a brainquake event VFX here (ground shaking etc.)InternalNodeContext: This is the elder brain speaking through the flaming fist. Different spekaer, same visuals.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jara begins to warp and turn. She will soon be a mind flayer.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_8.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_8.context: NodeContext: Utterly panicking as she sees her lover/client start to turn into a mind flayer.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jara's trasnformation completes. She is a full-on mind flayer standing before you.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_0.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_0.text: This looks personal. I should leave.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_25.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_25.text: *Your parasite stirs, and you gaze at the nymph through the Flaming Fist's hungry eyes. Your muscles shiver with her longing, your skin burns with her heat.*
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld between player and Flaming FIst Jara.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_11.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_11.context: NodeContext: Naoise looks at the Flaming Fist gripping her head and begins to worry.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_30.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_30.text: What are you... wait. I know you.
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flaming FIst Jara turns to player and frowns. She recognises you as a traitor to her cult.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_29.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_29.text: You aren't safe. Get out of here. Now!

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_32.speaker: Fist Jara
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_32.text: Your face. The Absolute has shown me.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_31.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_31.text: Jara, what's going on? Who's this person?

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jara speaks with the voice of the brain. (+ we need a brainquake event VFX here (ground shaking etc.)InternalNodeContext: This is the elder brain speaking through the flaming fist. Different spekaer, same visuals.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jara begins to warp and turn. She will soon be a mind flayer.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_22.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_22.text: *Your head screams in agony. The change has come - pustules boiling beneath your skin, your bones twisting, your flesh rupturing... and suddenly, silence.*
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds head in agony, like nothing they have ever felt. It then passes

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_2.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_2.context: NodeContext: Utterly panicking as she sees her lover/client start to turn into a mind flayer.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jara's trasnformation completes. She is a full-on mind flayer standing before you.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_4.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_4.text: Looks fun. Mind if I join?

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_26.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_26.text: I most certainly do! Jara is a most valued...

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_12.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_12.text: Whoever you think I am, you're mistaken.

NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_14.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_ThreeWay_NymphFlamingFist_14.text: This looks personal. I should leave.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_36.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_36.text: You're looking parched, sweetheart. Another tankard?
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Flaming Fist.NodeContext: Very inviting. Sex appeal turned up.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_18.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_18.text: Hells, darling - another sip, and I'm like to spill over.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Irenya.NodeContext: Extremely drunk and slurring.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_7.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_7.text: But I've a hankering for spicier flavours. How about you give me a taste.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to IrenyaNodeContext: Extremely drunk and slurring.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_3.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_3.text: Right as fallin' rain. What's it to you, chuffer?
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Extremely drunk and slurring. Aggressive to player.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_35.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_35.text: Don't worry your pretty head about the Fist, love. I can play them all like a lute.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_29.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_29.text: Ah hells, I get your point. No need for a damned racket.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player.NodeContext: Drunk, of course.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_2.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_2.text: See you around, doll. Keep that fire stoked for me.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] To Irenya while still holding his tankard. Leaves the scene and walks away to his right while still in a drunk state. Prefer to have his tankard up when he says "Keep that fire stoked for me" as he leaves. NodeContext: [SCENE] To Irenya while still holding his tankard. Leaves the scene and walks away to his right while still in a drunk state. Prefer to have his tankard up when he says "Keep that fire stoked for me" as he leaves.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_27.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_27.text: Dammit all, that guy's loaded. You just chased off a full coffer of tips.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Irritated

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_6.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_6.text: But I've still got one tip left, just for you: don't stand between a gal and her gold mine.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Irritated

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_11.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_11.text: Hells. You sound like an ogre thrust his spindle in a serpent.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Drunk, of course.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_41.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_41.text: Whaddya say, doll? Have a sit on my lap. Let's see what pops up.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Irenya.NodeContext: Extremely drunk and slurring. And quite lewd of course.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_40.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_40.text: Darling, how you set me a-quiver. You are a beast among men. No - a dragon, setting my phoenix nest aflame.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_8.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_8.context: NodeContext: Still drunk. A shuddering sigh of pleasure, under the nymph's spell.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_13.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_13.text: I shall slake your thirst, dragon. You will part your lips and drink of my essence.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_15.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_15.text: Ohh. I will drink your essence...
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_15.context: NodeContext: Still drunk. A shuddering sigh of pleasure, under the nymph's spell.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_4.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_4.text: Hoots - order up. Another tankard for the Fist!
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Calling outward to the bartender.NodeContext: Change of mood. Calls out a drink order.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_17.speaker: Irenya
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_17.text: And for you, a little advice, free of charge: when a gal's found her golden goose, don't try chasing it off.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Slightly irritated.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_10.speaker: Player
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_10.text: Get out, before I throw you out.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_19.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_19.text: All right, all right - no need to go baying for blood.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_43.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_43.text: Ooh, real tough customer. I'm quaking in my boots over here.
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_43.context: NodeContext: Sarcastically, still drunk of course.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_12.speaker: Player
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_12.text: Distasteful behaviour. Your ranking officer should know about this.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_34.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_34.text: Hells. Last thing I need's the manip on my arse.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_21.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_21.text: Pfft, you wanna snitch to the manip? Hell, he'd want his own piece! Now...

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_39.speaker: Player
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_39.text: I think it's time you got out of here, buddy.

Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_25.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
Taproom_Threeway_NymphDrunkFist_25.text: I think it's time you shut your gob. Buddy.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_0.speaker: Irenya
AD_NymphDrunkFist_0.text: You know, we can go upstairs whenever you'd like.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_2.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
AD_NymphDrunkFist_2.text: Ah ha, just let me slam another round first.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_6.speaker: Irenya
AD_NymphDrunkFist_6.text: I am all but arrested when you look at me like that.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_4.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
AD_NymphDrunkFist_4.text: Oh you should be locked up for that one.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_8.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
AD_NymphDrunkFist_8.text: You have the key to my heart in that sweet dress.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_5.speaker: Irenya
AD_NymphDrunkFist_5.text: I put it on especially for you.

AD_NymphDrunkFist_7.speaker: Fist Ghainemeir
AD_NymphDrunkFist_7.text: Don't take it off later. I want to give it a good rumple.

Chef_1.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_1.text: Not that type of service down here, love. I've got a husband, and you ain't my type.
Chef_1.context: NodeContext: Weary at having his cooking interrupted

Chef_10.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_10.text: I suppose. If you're willing to pay for it.
Chef_10.context: NodeContext: Reluctantly willing to cooperate if there's money involved

Chef_16.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_16.text: Now get out from under my feet, would you?
Chef_16.context: NodeContext: Dismissive/trying to get the player to leave him alone

Chef_2.speaker: Player
Chef_2.text: I'm not looking for 'service', thank you.

Chef_4.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_4.text: Thank the gods - I've had too many miscreants think my kitchen's just another themed playroom.

Chef_3.speaker: Player
Chef_3.text: I can do better than you anyway.

Chef_8.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_8.text: Not if you're looking for something to eat - now shoo.
Chef_8.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic/weary of the player's meddling

Chef_14.speaker: Player
Chef_14.text: I could show you pleasures your husband never could.

Chef_5.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_5.text: Yeah, yeah, I've heard it all before, pudding - now clear off.

Chef_13.speaker: Sauceman Chorizo
Chef_13.text: You'd better have a good reason for tearing me away from my prep station.
Chef_13.context: NodeContext: Irritated at having his cooking interrupted again

Taproom_Mamzell_41.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_41.text: It's a dwarf you crave, whip in hand. Go on - tell me I'm wrong.

Taproom_Mamzell_48.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_48.text: A weary traveller, battered and bruised. You come for sustenance. No - decadence.

Taproom_Mamzell_3.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_3.text: A mien cool as ice, yet eyes burning hot. Oh yes, I know your bliss:

Taproom_Mamzell_86.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_86.text: A sturdy dwarf, a leather whip. She gives - you receive. Or have I misjudged you?

Taproom_Mamzell_24.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_24.text: I thought as much. Those eyes tell a story. Punishment is your pleasure.

Taproom_Mamzell_50.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_50.text: Not my first choice, but I wouldn't say no.

Taproom_Mamzell_31.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_31.text: Of course you wouldn't. Who can resist the pleasure of the strap, once leather meets flesh?

Taproom_Mamzell_19.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_19.text: Am I? Your eyes tell a story, sweeting. You crave more than pleasure - you crave penance.

Taproom_Mamzell_59.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_59.text: It's Ffion you seek - our 'Stern Librarian'. She isn't here today, alas - your penance must wait.

Taproom_Mamzell_37.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_37.text: Alas, Ffion - our 'Stern Librarian' - has recently passed on.

Taproom_Mamzell_45.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_45.text: Well - we've other ways to fill your void. A drink, for one. A pair of drow, for another. Choose your sin.

Taproom_Mamzell_9.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_9.text: Will this 'Stern Librarian' of yours be back tomorrow?

Taproom_Mamzell_51.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_51.text: Sweeting, I'm no fortune-teller. If I had a crystal ball, I promise I'd already have consulted it.

Taproom_Mamzell_43.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_43.text: Truth is, Ffion's gone well missing. And my hands may be skilful, but they were not made to turn every last stone she might be hiding behind.

Taproom_Mamzell_56.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_56.text: You need help. Let me find Ffion for you.

Taproom_Mamzell_88.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_88.text: To service is my calling. Not to be served.

Taproom_Mamzell_46.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_46.text: *Sigh.* But I'd be a fool to say 'no'. The girl kept my coffers near overflowing.

Taproom_Mamzell_70.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_70.text: Two flights up, then turn right and right again. That's Ffion's pleasure room, Elminster's Library. Here - take the key.

Taproom_Mamzell_84.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_84.text: Two flights up, then turn right and right again. That's Ffion's pleasure room, Elminster's Library. Here's - oh, I've gone and lost the key.

Taproom_Mamzell_39.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_39.text: Well, you'll have to find your own way in. You're the resourceful sort, you'll figure it out.

Taproom_Mamzell_20.speaker: Gale
Taproom_Mamzell_20.text: 'Elminster's Library?' People will get their thrills in the strangest of places...
Taproom_Mamzell_20.context: NodeContext: 'there's no accounting for taste' - finds this absolutely bizarre as someone who knows Elminster

Taproom_Mamzell_77.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_77.text: Naoise's client turned into a mind flayer. I had to kill it.

Taproom_Mamzell_27.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_27.text: A mind flayer - here?! You mean Jara was -

Taproom_Mamzell_57.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_57.text: Hells. Naoise must be beside herself. Thank the Madam Sharess you were there to protect her.
Taproom_Mamzell_57.context: NodeContext: Madam = reference to the demigod.

Taproom_Mamzell_5.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_5.text: Please - don't spread word of this. Sharess' Caress lives or dies by its reputation.

Taproom_Mamzell_38.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_38.text: You have drow escorts on hand? That does sound tempting.

Taproom_Mamzell_58.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_58.text: Twins, yes. Hands of such skill they could turn stone to silk. Your body could suffer no knot they can't untangle.

Taproom_Mamzell_52.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_52.text: They're through the curtain to the right.

Taproom_Mamzell_66.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_66.text: You'll need coin and stamina in abundance to enjoy their services - but the gold will be as well-spent as you are.

Taproom_Mamzell_68.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_68.text: They're occupied at the moment, but come back later - they'll want to explore every part of you.

Taproom_Mamzell_81.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_81.text: Are there other options for... companionship?

Taproom_Mamzell_47.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_47.text: Well, there's Naoise, our lovely nymph - but she'll be in no state for companionship. Not after... not after what happened.

Taproom_Mamzell_78.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_78.text: Naoise, our lovely nymph - but she's engaged in the Nymph's Grotto on the top floor, sweeting.

Taproom_Mamzell_1.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_1.text: The client's a favourite of hers, too. I doubt you'll be able to tear her away.

Taproom_Mamzell_35.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_35.text: But we are blessed to have a devil in residence at the moment - a temporary guest, but he asked that I send any potential clients his way.

Taproom_Mamzell_85.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_85.text: Everyone who's paid a visit looks quite changed by the experience.

Taproom_Mamzell_2.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_2.text: I found Ffion's corpse. She's been murdered.

Taproom_Mamzell_8.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_8.text: Murdered? Ye gods, the poor thing. By the Mother of Cats, I pray she didn't suffer.

Taproom_Mamzell_53.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_53.text: I'll miss that face. Hells, the regulars will miss her more. They swarmed her like honeybees at the hive.

Taproom_Mamzell_6.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_6.text: *Sigh.* Losing Ffion's slashed a big hole in my coinpurse. I should get to replacing her.

Taproom_Mamzell_75.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_75.text: A woman is dead, and you're concerned about money?

Taproom_Mamzell_44.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_44.text: Sweeting, this is Baldur's Gate. I've seen more murders than a butcher's right eye.

Taproom_Mamzell_42.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_42.text: There will be time for tears. Cruel as it is, I must turn my mind to business - or more precisely, the lack of it.

Taproom_Mamzell_36.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_36.text: Surely you can spare a reward for this information?

Taproom_Mamzell_62.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_62.text: I have little coin - but I offer sin in abundance.

Taproom_Mamzell_82.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_82.text: Talk with the drow twins in the taproom. They're legends among the regulars. Almost myths. Tell them they're your gift from the Mamzell - and let them show you why.

Taproom_Mamzell_21.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_21.text: Our drow twins make a salacious coupling - but they're sadly occupied. Come by later; I'd hate for you to miss out.

Taproom_Mamzell_14.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_14.text: They're legends among the regulars. Almost myths. Tell them they're your gift from the Mamzell - and let them show you why.

Taproom_Mamzell_10.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_10.text: Anything else on your mind, sweeting?

Taproom_Mamzell_60.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_60.text: I can spare a little something - and a smile. I hope you can make do.

Taproom_Mamzell_28.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_28.text: I'm sure you can spare a little something for me, at least.

Taproom_Mamzell_29.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_29.text: In the Flophouse lies a fresh-killed corpse: a lady dwarf. Could that be Ffion?

Taproom_Mamzell_80.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_80.text: Did the devil give you its name?

Taproom_Mamzell_79.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_79.text: Exceedingly handsome, and with a voice that could make the foulest blasphemy seem the sweetest hymn.

Taproom_Mamzell_87.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_87.text: Can we not talk about this?

Taproom_Mamzell_63.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_63.text: Sweeting, are you blushing? There is no shame in pleasure. Even less when the pleasure is pain.

Taproom_Mamzell_17.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_17.text: You've misjudged me terribly - she'll need three costume changes minimum.

Taproom_Mamzell_25.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_25.text: Oh, you crave a performance... How decadent.

Taproom_Mamzell_34.speaker: Player
Taproom_Mamzell_34.text: My sole desire is to dominate the world over and leave it trembling beneath my feet.

Taproom_Mamzell_64.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_64.text: One of those, are you? There's plenty of room for roleplay in our establishment.

Taproom_Mamzell_54.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_54.text: If you have a change of heart and wish to be subdued, it's Ffion you should speak to when she comes back.

Taproom_Mamzell_26.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_26.text: Alas, we might struggle to restrain you if we tried, as our 'Stern Librarian' Ffion recently passed on.

Taproom_Mamzell_67.speaker: Mamzell Amira
Taproom_Mamzell_67.text: A drow or a drink, sweeting? There is no thirst I cannot quench.

NymphRoom_Nymph_25.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_25.text: If you seek rapture, find it elsewhere. I can show you but once.

NymphRoom_Nymph_39.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_39.text: One moment, forever emblazoned on my memories. I won't soon forget it.

NymphRoom_Nymph_55.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_55.text: Hells - I'd heard tales of mind flayers. Talons sharp as daggers, and tentacles yet more fearsome.

NymphRoom_Nymph_49.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_49.text: But no tale did justice to its ethereal beauty. It floats like a butterfly, its blood shimmers like silver.

NymphRoom_Nymph_82.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_82.text: That thing could have killed you, and you're musing on its beauty?

NymphRoom_Nymph_104.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_104.text: How could I help it? I don't regret its death. But I marvel that such a work of art could ever live.

NymphRoom_Nymph_106.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_106.text: Your client is dead. I thought you'd be more upset.

NymphRoom_Nymph_52.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_52.text: Who? Oh yes - Jara. I will miss her coin, it's true. Though perhaps this is not what you meant.

NymphRoom_Nymph_3.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_3.text: Free your mind of her. Let us look forward, never back.

NymphRoom_Nymph_45.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_Nymph_45.text: *Her gaze intensifies. Your breath quickens, and your heart skips a beat.*

NymphRoom_Nymph_71.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_Nymph_71.text: *The woman's senses are heightened, and her fires stoked. The mind flayer is no mere curiosity, but an object of desire.*

NymphRoom_Nymph_73.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_73.text: The creature aroused you, didn't it?

NymphRoom_Nymph_30.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_30.text: Why should I deny it? My urge is as natural as the grape upon the vine.

NymphRoom_Nymph_78.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_78.text: That thing turned you on? Disgusting.

NymphRoom_Nymph_11.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_11.text: Desire is instinct, to both mortal and immortal. It's no more disgusting than the mulberry fresh on its bush.

NymphRoom_Nymph_72.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_72.text: But perhaps there are other flavours that might satisfy my palate.
NymphRoom_Nymph_72.context: NodeContext: Sexily. She's making a passionate offer, though not the one the player expects

NymphRoom_Nymph_46.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_46.text: What did you have in mind?

NymphRoom_Nymph_102.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_102.text: I'm not interested in sex, but thanks.

NymphRoom_Nymph_2.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_2.text: Not sex. Something far more intoxicating.

NymphRoom_Nymph_97.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_Nymph_97.text: *You see only darkness. Her voice shines through it, warmer than sun yet cooler than night.*

NymphRoom_Nymph_59.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_59.text: The all-being. Here, there is no suffering. Here, you want for nothing. Here, you are anything.

NymphRoom_Nymph_61.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_61.text: You have one word. Tell me: what will you be?

NymphRoom_Nymph_32.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_32.text: You are more than revered - you are worshipped. An epic sung by the bards, a legend known to the scholars. A god among mortals.

NymphRoom_Nymph_21.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_21.text: When the hosts of the planes raise their voices in harmony, it is your name they sing, and your grace they seek.

NymphRoom_Nymph_35.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_35.text: You are more than contented - you are at total peace. Your belly is full, your mind rested, your eyes bright.

NymphRoom_Nymph_31.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_31.text: No more will you hear the clang of steel on steel. No more will you fear the cry of a wolf, the growl of an ogre. You are warm. You are safe.

NymphRoom_Nymph_1.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_1.text: You are more than powerful. An emperor to emperors, your head adorned with a crown of gold, diamond, and ruby.

NymphRoom_Nymph_101.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_101.text: The heavens tremble with the steps of your army. All beasts, all men and women, all creatures of the planes bow to your might.

NymphRoom_Nymph_6.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_6.text: You are more than rich - you are the picture of luxury. Your nakedness cloaked in the robes of thrice-combed silk, woven with silver and golden threads.

NymphRoom_Nymph_48.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_48.text: Thirteen castles, each encircled by thirteen fertile gardens. Platinum coins spill forth from thirteen-and-thirty coffers.

NymphRoom_Nymph_8.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_8.text: You are sane. Time dances on in sequence, the winding path of time evens, and becomes straight.

NymphRoom_Nymph_81.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_81.text: With a quiet head, you can once again hear the song of the birds and the wind in the grass. You pluck a flower, and it does not bleed.

NymphRoom_Nymph_5.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_5.text: You are whole. Within and without, free from expectation and the crushing burden of solitude.

NymphRoom_Nymph_60.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_60.text: You are the entirety of you. Every path outward leads to adventures yet unknown. Every path inward leads to dreams eternally fulfilled.

NymphRoom_Nymph_64.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_64.text: You are safe. The winds of fate blow you to the warmest of hearths in the most cordial of inns.

NymphRoom_Nymph_95.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_95.text: Your seething passions lead only to pleasure. The touch of the sun comforts your flesh, but never burns it.

NymphRoom_Nymph_100.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_100.text: You are alive. Your senses vibrate with sensation - smell, taste, touch, sound, sight. All alert to the beauty of now.

NymphRoom_Nymph_107.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_107.text: The sound of your heart - your heart - beats a steady rhythm: Hello, hello, hello.

NymphRoom_Nymph_86.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_86.text: You are wise. The erudition of the ages flows through you and from you, illuminating the scholars who seek your counsel.

NymphRoom_Nymph_47.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_47.text: You know yourself, for such is the beginning of all wisdom. When souls would drink the waters of learning, you are their font.

NymphRoom_Nymph_89.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_89.text: Er - you are Minsc. You are the most Minsc. Wherever you go, there is only Minsc.
NymphRoom_Nymph_89.context: NodeContext: Confused but making it work

NymphRoom_Nymph_12.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_12.text: Every step, every breath, every thought shall be - the Minsc-est.
NymphRoom_Nymph_12.context: NodeContext: Confused but making it work

NymphRoom_Nymph_90.speaker: Narrator
NymphRoom_Nymph_90.text: *Your flesh shivers, your heart bursts. True ecstasy, for one fleeting moment.*

NymphRoom_Nymph_0.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens their eyes at enhd of line.

NymphRoom_Nymph_4.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_4.context: NodeContext: Sweetly and absolutely sincere. She means it.

NymphRoom_Nymph_53.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_53.context: NodeContext: Sweet and sincere. Not an ounce of arrogance to it.

NymphRoom_Nymph_41.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_41.text: Then be free. You are an eagle, the most divine of messengers, soaring above the peak of Mount Sundabar.

NymphRoom_Nymph_108.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_108.text: No man or woman, no devil or demon, no goddess or god dares confine you within one border or one creed.

NymphRoom_Nymph_65.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_65.text: The gods themselves cannot grant you my unimaginable bliss. Refuse it once, and you will be left forever wanting.

NymphRoom_Nymph_93.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_93.text: Show me. Let me know bliss.

NymphRoom_Nymph_75.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_75.text: Tell me, then. In a word: what will you be?

NymphRoom_Nymph_77.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_77.text: Then a part of you remains forever empty, yet keenly felt. An ultimate unknowing, beyond your grasp.

NymphRoom_Nymph_68.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_68.text: At least - take these. May you have at least some comfort in bitter times.
NymphRoom_Nymph_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens their eyes. Nymph performs a generic "gives a reward" gesture.

NymphRoom_Nymph_20.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_20.text: I won't forget you. And you won't forget me.

NymphRoom_Nymph_85.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_85.text: Show me. Let me know bliss.

NymphRoom_Nymph_33.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_33.text: Close your eyes. Listen to my voice.

NymphRoom_Nymph_94.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_94.text: You could just give me a few coins instead.

NymphRoom_Nymph_37.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_37.text: I offer something rarer than coin -

NymphRoom_Nymph_88.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_88.text: Well, then. I'm glad you're safe.

NymphRoom_Nymph_16.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_16.text: As am I. My thanks are bountiful as your courage.

NymphRoom_Nymph_103.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_103.text: Take these. May you have some comfort in bitter times.
NymphRoom_Nymph_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not custom! A generic "gives a reward" gesture.

NymphRoom_Nymph_63.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_63.text: Damn. You're almost as disturbing as the mind flayer.

NymphRoom_Nymph_26.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_26.text: If my innate desires make me disturbing, then I proudly claim the title.

NymphRoom_Nymph_22.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_22.text: You know illithid are literally incapable of desiring you back?

NymphRoom_Nymph_54.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_54.text: Oh, I don't need it to desire me back. That's wholly unimportant.

NymphRoom_Nymph_27.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_27.text: I'm not one to judge, but desiring an extraplanar being like that is peculiar.

NymphRoom_Nymph_14.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_14.text: No desire is 'peculiar', it is instinct - and instinct never lies.

NymphRoom_Nymph_13.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_13.text: So the critics have said of Faerûn's greatest masterpieces. I'm not so cold-hearted, nor so short-sighted.

NymphRoom_Nymph_96.speaker: Player
NymphRoom_Nymph_96.text: They are beautiful indeed - and most lethal.

NymphRoom_Nymph_10.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_10.text: Is it not in the illithid's barbarity that we find its splendour?

NymphRoom_Nymph_56.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_56.text: Your eyes are no less monstrous, I assure you. A lesser woman might be frightened. But I am no lesser woman.

NymphRoom_Nymph_92.speaker: Naoise Nallinto
NymphRoom_Nymph_92.text: I'm afraid I'm not taking new clients.

BoastingCrooks_AD_8.speaker: Earspoon
BoastingCrooks_AD_8.text: ...over her head... a betting man, I'd bet against her...
BoastingCrooks_AD_8.context: NodeContext: Whispering, only some words coming through.

Dancer_01_0.speaker: Queen Rhol, the Despoiler
Dancer_01_0.text: We can dance if you want to.

Dancer_01_1.speaker: Queen Rhol, the Despoiler
Dancer_01_1.text: You can stare as much as you like.
